subject: RE: [junit] Re: JUnit considered problematic
msgSnippet: Please document String.substring(int, int) using DBC. Thanks!
messageBody:
Please document String.substring(int, int) using DBC. Thanks!

> -----Original Message-----
> From: javainsel [mailto:javainsel@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, April 02, 2003 5:52 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: JUnit considered problematic
>
>
> > To facilitate the discussion, could you just write a small example?
>
> Preconditions and Postconditions
>
> /**
> * @pre f >= 0.0
> * @post Math.abs((return * return) - f) < 0.001
> */
> public float sqrt(float f) { ... }
>
> Invariants:
>
> /**
> * A PositiveInteger is an Integer that is guaranteed to be positive.
> *
> * @inv intValue() > 0
> */
> class PositiveInteger extends Integer { ... }
>
